S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureCatalogue.S100FC:name: JCOMM S-411 Sea Ice Feature Catalogue
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureCatalogue.S100FC:scope: Ice information for navigation in ice covered areas

S100CI:address.S100CI:deliveryPoint: 7 bis, avenue de la Paix - P.O. Box 2300

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Total Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEACT specifies the total concentration of ice in an area. It represents the ratio expressed in tenths describing the total area of the water surface covered by ice as a fraction of the whole area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Partial Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEAPC specifies the partial concentrations of ice in an area. (‘Ca, Cband Cc’).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Stage of Development
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ice Stage of Development describes the ages and thicknesses of the ice (‘So, Sa, Sb, Sc and Sd’).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Thin First Year Ice (30 to <70 cm)
Thin First Year Ice Stage 1 (30 to <50 cm)
Thin First Year Ice Stage 2 (50 to <70 cm)
Medium First Year Ice (70 to 120 cm)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Lake Ice Stage of Development
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Lake Ice Stages of Development describe the ages and thicknesses of lake ice. (‘So, Sa, Sb, Sc and Sd’)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Floe Sizes
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Floe Sizes describe the predominate forms of ice floe sizes (Fa, Fb and Fc) corresponding to the ice Stages of Development Sa, Sb and Screspectively.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Shuga/Small Ice Cake; Brash Ice (<2m across)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Melt Stage
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The Stage of Melt describes the stages of the melting ice. Puddle: An accumulation of water on ice, mainly due to the melting of snow, but in some more advanced stages also the melting of ice. Thaw Hole: Vertical holes formed in ice when surface puddles melt through to the underlying water. Dried Ice: Ice surface from which water has disappeared after the formation of cracks and thaw holes. During the process of drying the surface whitens. Rotten Ice: Ice which has become honey-combed and is in an advanced state of disintegration. Flooded Ice: Ice which has been flooded and is heavily loaded by water or water and wet snow. Frozen Puddle: A puddle which has frozen over.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Concentration of Strips and Patches
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A strip is a long narrow area of floating ice, about 1 kilometre or less in width, usually composed of small fragments detached from the main mass of ice, and run together under the influence of wind, swell or current. If the area of ice becomes more rounded in shape, it is referred to as a patch. ICESPC indicates the concentration in tenths within the area of Strips and Patches.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Number of Icebergs in Area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEBNM indicates the number of Icebergs within a specified area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Level Ice
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICELVL is an indication as to whether or not the ice has been affected by deformation

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Compacting Strength
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICECST is an indication of strength of the compacting of the ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Fracture Type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEFTY indicates the type of fracture, based upon width.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Lead Status
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The Ice Lead Status indicates the surface nature of the lead.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency of Leads or Fractures
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERFQ indicates the frequency of leads or fractures in number per nautical mile.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation of Leads or Fractures
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICELOR indicates the predominant orientation of leads and fractures.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Lead (or Fracture or Crack) Width
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICELWD indicates the width of a lead or fracture or crack in metres.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Location Information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICELOC indicates whether the break is at a specific location, or whether there is a presence in the area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Iceberg Size
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The "Iceberg Size" categorizes the size of an iceberg.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Ice Island (in the Northern Hemisphere) or Very Large Tabular Berg (in the Southern Ocean)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Drift Direction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEDDR indicates the direction in which an ice mass is drifting.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Drift Speed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEDSP describes the speed in knots at which an ice mass is traveling.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Average Thickness
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ice Average Thickness defines the average thickness of the ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum Ice Thickness
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEMAX specifies the maximum thickness of the ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Mimimum Ice Thickness
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEMIN specifies the minimum thickness of the ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Thickness Type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICETTY indicated whether the thickness of the ice was measured or estimated.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Snow Depth
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICESCT specifies the depth of snow cover on the ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Snow Cover Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICESCN indicates the concentration (aerial coverage) of snow in tenths.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Direction of Sastrugi
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEDOS indicates the bearing of a sastrugi. Sastrugi are sharp, irregular ridges formed on a snow surface by wind erosion and deposition. On mobile floating ice the ridges are parallel to the direction of the wind at the time they were formed.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Ridge Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERCN describes the concentration of hummocked ice in an ice area. Up to three values may be given in the list to correspond to the partial concentrations in ICEAPC.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Ridge Classification
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERDV describes the predominant type of ice ridge(s) present.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Ridge Mean Height
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERMH indicates the mean height of ice ridge(s) in decimetres.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Ridge Frequency
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERFQ indicates the frequency of ice ridges in number per nautical mile

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Ridge Maximum Height
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERMT indicates the maximum height of ice ridge(s) in decimetres.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Keel Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEKCN describes the concentration of ice keels beneath an ice area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Keel Frequency
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERFQ indicates the frequency of ice keels in number per nautical mile

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Keel Mean Depth
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates the mean depth of ice keels in decimetres.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Keel Maximum Depth
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICERMT indicates the maximum depth of ice keels in decimetres.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Rafting Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEFCN describes the concentration of ice rafting in an ice area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Snow cover
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Snow cover describes the degree of snow cover in an ice area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Stage of Melting
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_MLT describes the stage of melting according to the 5-point Russian national scale

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Contamination
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_PLG describes the degree of contamination (aerial coverage) in thirds based on the Russian national 3-point scale.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Hills Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_HLG describes the degree of hilling in an ice area (usually multi-year ice).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Slight to moderate concentration of hills
Moderate to heavy concentration of hills

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Fractures Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_DUG describes the degree of disunity in an ice area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency of Cracks and Leads seldom in 10 km on Route
Frequency of Cracks and Leads in 5 – 10 km on Route
Frequency of Cracks and Leads in 3 – 5 km on Route
Frequency of Cracks and Leads in 2 – 3 km on Route
Frequency of Cracks and Leads often in 2 km on Route
Small and Medium Floes – 1/10-3/10; Big Floes – 7/10-10/10 Conc.
Small and Medium Floes – 4/10-6/10; Big Floes – 4/10-6/10 Conc.
Small and Medium Floes – 7/10-10/10; Big Floes – 1/10-3/10 Conc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Iceberg Concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_BCN specifies the total concentration of icebergs in an area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Prevailing Iceberg Form
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_BFM specifies the prevailing form of icebergs in an area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum Height of Above Water Part (iceberg/grounded hummock)
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_BUF specifies the maximum height of an iceberg above the waterline in meters.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Number of Ice Objects
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_OBN defines the number of ice objects (cracks, leads, fractures, icebergs).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Average Width of Ice Lead (or Fracture or Crack)
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEDVW defines the average width of the lead or fracture or crack

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum Width of Ice Lead (or Fracture or Crack)
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_DXW defines the maximum width of the lead or fracture or crack.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum Width of Ice Lead (or Fracture or Crack)
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_DMW defines the minimum width of the lead or fracture or crack.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Brash Ice
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: ICEBRS specifies the concentrations of very thick brash (“AV”), thick brash (“AK”), medium brash (“AM”) and thin brash ice (“AT”).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Floe Size FF
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Size of ice floes (ff) for ia_sfa, ia_sfb, ia_sfc, ia_ffa, ia_ffb, ia_ffc complex attributes

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Shuga/Small Ice Cake; Brash Ice (<2 m)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Stage of Development SS
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Stage of develpment (ss) for ia_sfa, ia_sfb, ia_sfc, ia_ffa, ia_ffb, ia_ffc complex attributes

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Thin First Year Ice (30 to <70 cm)
Thin First Year Ice Stage 1 (30 to <50 cm)
Thin First Year Ice Stage 2 (50 to <70 cm)
Medium First Year Ice (70 to 120 cm)

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Combination Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the 1st partial concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_SFA describes combination(s) of Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the first partial concentration in an ice area. Up to three (stage of development / form of ice) combinations are allowed to describe the ice in the first partial concentration group.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Combination Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the 2nd partial concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_SFB describes combination(s) of Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the first partial concentration in an ice area. Up to three (stage of development / form of ice) combinations are allowed to describe the ice in the first partial concentration group.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Combination Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the 3rd partial concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: IA_SFC describes combination(s) of Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the first partial concentration in an ice area. Up to three (stage of development / form of ice) combinations are allowed to describe the ice in the first partial concentration group.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Breccia for the first partial concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ice breccia is pieces of ice of different ages frozen together. IA _FFA describes the combination(s) of Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the first partial concentration in an ice area. Up to three (stage of development / form of ice) combinations plus the age of the younger ice consolidating the main pieces are allowed to describe the ice in the first partial concentration group.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Breccia for the second partial concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ice breccia is pieces of ice of different ages frozen together. IA _FFA describes the combination(s) of Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the first partial concentration in an ice area. Up to three (stage of development / form of ice) combinations plus the age of the younger ice consolidating the main pieces are allowed to describe the ice in the first partial concentration group.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Ice Breccia for the third partial concentration
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ice breccia is pieces of ice of different ages frozen together. IA _FFA describes the combination(s) of Ice Stage of Development and Floe Size for the first partial concentration in an ice area. Up to three (stage of development / form of ice) combinations plus the age of the younger ice consolidating the main pieces are allowed to describe the ice in the first partial concentration group.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Sea Ice
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Sea Ice is an area at sea that is covered, in whole or in part, with ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Lake Ice
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Lake Ice is an area on a lake that is covered, in whole or in part, with ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Iceberg Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An Iceberg Area is an area at sea in which icebergs, bergy bits, or growlers are present.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Edge
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The demarcation at any given time between the open sea and sea ice of any kind and in any concentration, whether fast or drifting.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Iceberg Limit
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Limit of all known Icebergs.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Limit of Open Water
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The demarcation at any given time between sea ice and freely navigable water, in which sea ice is present in concentrations less than 1/10.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Limit of All Known Ice
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The limit of all known ice, including both sea ice of any kind and icebergs.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Line of Ice Ridge
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Line of Ice Ridge is a line or wall of broken ice forced up by pressure processes.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Line of Ice Lead
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Line of Ice Lead identifies any passage-way(s) through ice which is (are) navigable by surface vessels.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Line of Ice Fracture
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Any break or rupture through the ice cover, or through the single floe, resulting from deformation processes. Length may vary from a few meters to a few kilometers.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Line of Ice Crack
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Line of Ice Crack identifies any ice breakup, but no passage-way(s) for surface vessels.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Compacting
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Pieces of ice are said to be compacting when they are subjected to a converging motion, which increases ice concentration and/or produces stresses which may result in ice deformation.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Lead
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Ice Lead identifies any fracture(s) or passage-way(s) through ice which is (are) navigable by surface vessels.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Iceberg
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An Iceberg is a massive piece of ice, greatly varying in shape and showing more than 5 meters above the sea surface which has broken away from a glacier, and which may be afloat or grounded. This Object Class also includes smaller forms of glacial ice, known as “Bergy Bits” and “Growlers”, which are defined by their size Attribute. ICEBRG can indicate the location of a single iceberg or, if the attribute IA_OBN is specified and is greater than 1, multiple icebergs in the vicinity of a point.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Floeberg
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A Floeberg is a massive piece of sea ice composed of a hummock or a group of hummocks, frozen together and separated from any ice surroundings. They typically protrude up to 5 meters above the sea surface.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Thickness
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Ice Thickness provides a measure or estimate of ice thickness.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Shear
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area of drift ice is subject to shear when the ice motion varies significantly in the direction normal to the motion, subjecting the ice to rotational forces.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Divergence
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Ice fields or floes in an area are subject to diverging or dispersive motion, thus reducing ice concentration and/or relieving stresses in the ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Ridge/Hummock
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An Ice Ridge is a line or wall of broken ice forced up by pressure. A Hummock is a hillock of broken ice which has been forced upward by pressure.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Keel/Bummock
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: From a submariner’s point of view, a Keel is a downward projecting ridge on the underside of the ice canopy - the counterpart of a Ridge. A Bummock is the counterpart of a hummock on the underside of the ice canopy.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Drift
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Motion of an ice field or floe as a result of forces such as wind and currents.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Fracture
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Any break or rupture through the ice pack, or a single floe, resulting from deformation processes. Length may vary from a few metres to many kilometres.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ice Rafting
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Pressure processes whereby one piece of ice overrides another.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Jammed Brash Barrier
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A strip or narrow belt of new, young or brash ice (usually 100-500 metres wide) formed at the edge of either drift or fast ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Stage of Melt
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A description of the stage of melt of the ice; i.e. whether it has formed puddles on the surface and whether these have frozen.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Snow Cover
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A description of the amount of snow covering the ice.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Strips and Patches
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A strip is a long narrow area of floating ice, about 1 kilometre or less in width, usually composed of small fragments detached from the main mass of ice, and run together under the influence of wind, swell or current. If the area of ice becomes more rounded in shape, it is referred to as a patch.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Grounded Hummock
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Grounded Hummock identifies a hummock formation which is stranded.
